summary: An internal email from November 30, 2018, discussing the FBI NY office's initiation of an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It mentions coordination with the FBI Palm Beach office, the identification of at least three New York victims, and concerns about the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) as a potential hurdle. The email also references a memo justifying the NPA.

events.title: FBI NY Opens Epstein Investigation
events.description: The FBI New York office is opening an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and has prepared an initiation sheet. They are coordinating with the FBI Palm Beach office and have identified at least three New York victims from electronic files.

keyFacts: FBI New York is opening an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein as of November 30, 2018.
The FBI has access to electronic files from the FBI Palm Beach office and has identified at least three New York victims, including one who helped recruit others.
The 'scheduler' for Epstein, who received non-prosecution protection, often worked from New York.
The investigation is being coordinated with the FBI Palm Beach office, which is reportedly not resistant to the NY office pursuing the case.
A primary concern is the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), with a need to ensure the Main Justice Department will not be a hurdle before interviewing victims.
